bool operator==( const regex_iterator&amp; rhs ) const;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|until=c++20|1=
bool operator!=( const regex_iterator&amp; rhs ) const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Compares two {{tt|regex_iterator}}s.

{{rrev|since=c++20|
{{cpp/note synthesized eq}}
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|rhs|a {{tt|regex_iterator}} to compare to}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
For the sake of exposition, assume that {{tt|regex_iterator}} contains the following members:
* {{tt|BidirIt begin}};
* {{tt|BidirIt end}};
* {{c|const regex_type *pregex;}}
* {{c|std::regex_constants::match_flag_type flags;}}
* {{c|std::match_results&lt;BidirIt&gt; match;}}

@1@ Returns {{c|true}} if {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} are both end-of-sequence iterators, or if all of the following conditions are true:
* {{c|begin {{==}} rhs.begin}}
* {{c|end {{==}} rhs.end}}
* {{c|pregex {{==}} rhs.pregex}}
* {{c|flags {{==}} rhs.flags}}
* {{c|match[0] {{==}} rhs.match[0]}}
 
@2@ Returns {{c|!(*this {{==}} rhs)}}.
